### Fishery-Dependent Data


```{r}
#| label: fig-catches
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| eval: true
#| fig-cap: "Total removals for quillback rockfish in California from 1916-2024 for the commercial (blue bars; CA_Commercial) and recreational (red bars; CA_Recreational) fleets. The y-axis units are metric tons."
#| fig-alt: "Stacked bar plot showing total removals were low through the 1940s, rising from the 1960s through 2000 and remaining relatively stable thereafter, with the majority of removals being from the recreational fleet, with removals from the commercial fleet largest in the 1990s."

knitr::include_graphics(
    "r4ss_plots/catch2_landings_stacked.png"
)
```


```{r}
#| label: fig-data

#| fig-alt: "Tabular information for this figure can be found in the data file."

knitr::include_graphics("r4ss_plots/data_plot2.png")
```

```{r}
#| label: fig-growthdata
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| eval: true
#| fig-cap: "Available length-at-age data for the 2025 stock assessment. Growth curves are provided based on the external estimate of all data (red open circles; top), and from the internally estimated values from a subset of the data within the base model (brown open circles; bottom). The fixed growth curve from the 2021 assessment is also provided for comparison."
#| fig-alt: "There are lengths for age zero fish, but the majority of data are for fish from approximately 24 to 44 cm. The 2021 assessment used a high value for L infinity with fish reaching that age at a smaller length. The 2025 external estimate has a slightly lower estimate for k, and a lower L infinity. The 2025 model estimate has a smaller value of k and reaches a similar L infinity as the 2021 model, around 43 cm."

knitr::include_graphics(
    "figures/bio_growth_postSTAR.png"
)
```


```{r}
#| label: fig-growth
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| eval: true
#| fig-cap: "Model estimated length-at-age in the beginning of the year. Shaded area indicates 95 percent distribution of length-at-age around the estimated growth curve."
#| fig-alt: "Growth curves for females and males diverge are similar up to about age 8 after which females are notably larger. For both sexes the growth asymptotes around age 20. See parameter table for growth parameters."

knitr::include_graphics(
    "r4ss_plots/bio1_sizeatage.png"
)
```
